intro: Borago zeylanica, commonly known as Indian borage, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, blue or purple flowers and hairy, oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks. The leaves and flowers are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
